info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 12:21PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Deer Lodge, east central Granite, Silver Bow and southeastern Powell Counties through 115 PM MDT... At 1221 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Garrison to 17 miles north of Wisdom. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deer Lodge, Butte, Anaconda, Silver Bow, Walkerville, Warm Springs, Galen, Gregson Hot Springs, Divide, Garrison, West Valley, Nissler, Crackerville, Fishtrap, Racetrack, Lost Creek, Opportunity, Ramsay, Janney and Newcomb. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 171 and 230. Highway 12 Garrison to MacDonald Pass between mile markers 0 and 6, and between mile markers 16 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
